text: {{Infobox writer | name = Paul Goble | image= Goble.jpg | caption = | birth_date = | birth_place = Haslemere, England, U.K. | death_date = | occupation = Illustrator, writer | nationality = American | period = | genre = Children's picture books | subject = Native Americans | notableworks = | awards = }} Paul Goble (27 September 1933 - 5 January 2017) was an English writer and illustrator of children's books. He especially wrote about Native American stories. His book The Girl Who Loved Wild Horses won a Caldecott Medal in 1979. Goble died from Parkinson's disease on 5 January 2017, aged 83. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Writers from Surrey
